solution_line_template: Since the angles in a triangle adds up to {total_angle_sum}, and A is 40 degrees, B and C have a total of {total_angle_sum}-{angle_A} = <<{total_angle_sum}-{angle_A}={sum_B_C}>>{sum_B_C} degrees.
The angle of C is C={sum_B_C}/{divisor_for_C}
Since B is two times as big as C, B is {multiplier_B}*{angle_C} = {angle_B} degrees.
